Fund.ManagerBio: Fitterer is a portfolio manager with Wells Fargo. Prior to that, Fitterer was with Strong Capital Management from 1989 to April 2005. Previously, he served as a fixed-income research analyst and trader and as a manager of the Strong Funds fixed-income accounting department. Fitterer is a Chartered Financial Analyst and a Certified Public Accountant.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks federally tax-exempt income with a low degree of share-price fluctuation. The fund primarily invests in ultra-short-term, higher- and medium-quality municipal bonds. Management intends to maintain an average effective portfolio maturity of one year or less. The fund may also invest a limited portion of its assets in bonds that have longer maturities or are of lower-quality, though it may not invest in bonds rated below BB. The managers focus upon high-yield bonds rated BB with positive or improving credit fundamentals.
Fund.Name: Wells Fargo Advantage Ult S/T Mun In Inv

Fund.ManagerBio: Eck joined Cooke & Bieler in 1980 and left in 1984 to become director of product marketing for Eczel Corp. From 1987 to 1992, he served as executive vice president of Keystone Natural Water. He rejoined Cooke & Bieler in 1992 and currently is a partner, portfolio manager and research analyst. Eck holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks maximum long-term, after-tax total return, consistent with minimizing risk to principal. The fund invests principally in securities of large-capitalization companies, which are defined as those with market capitalizations of $3 billion or more. The fund invest up to 25% of the fund's assets in foreign securities through ADRs and similar investments.
Fund.Name: Wells Fargo Advantage Value A

Fund.ManagerBio: Blomster is vice president and director of research with Wells Capital Management, sub-advisor to Wells Fargo Funds. He is known for developing the Yield Curve Model, which has been featured in leading financial publications. Previously, he was a vice president, director of research and portfolio manager with Norwest Investment Management. Blomster holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks current income; capital appreciation is a secondary consideration. The portfolio typically invests 20% of assets in stock funds and 80% of assets in bond funds. The funds are affiliated and non-affiliated underlying funds. Bond holdings are spread across short to intermediate term, income-producing securities, such as U.S. government obligations, corporate bonds, below investment-grade bonds, and foreign issues. Stock holdings are diversified across large company growth, large company value, small company, and international investment styles.

Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks total return that is exempt from federal and Wisconsin personal income taxes. The fund invests at least 80% of its assets in municipal obligations, whose interest is exempt from Wisconsin and federal personal income taxes, including the federal AMT. It invests at least 65% of total net assets in higher amd medium quality securities. To enhance it's return the fund manager may elect to invest up to 25% of total net assets in securities of lower quality. The fund manager may also invest up to 20% of total net assets in taxable securities of comparable quality to its investments in municipal obligations.
Fund.Name: Wells Fargo Advantage WI Tax-Free C

Fund.ManagerBio: Mr. Escario joined Rydex in January 2000. He is involved in the investment teams that manage the Rydex benchmark and sector funds. Additionally, he is a member of the investment team responsible for managing the Rydex Core Equity Fund. He holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks investment results corresponding to the performance of the S&P REIT index. The fund invests normally at least 95% of assets in the stocks included in the S&P REIT index. It typically invests in stocks represented in the index in proportions substantially similar to the index. The fund normally invests in all of the stocks which comprise the index, except when changes are made to the index itself.
Fund.Name: Wells S&P REIT Index A

He was previously a fixed income investment manager with Principal Financial Group
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks regular current income, capital preservation and long-term capital appreciation. The fund normallyl invests 50%-75% of its assets in common stocks and securities convertible into common stock such as rights, warrants, convertible preferred stock and convertible stock. It may invest in the equity securities of issuers of all sizes. The fund generally will invest at least 25% of its assets in investment grade fixed income securities and may also invest up to 20% of its total assets in fixed income securities which are non-investment grade or unrated. It is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: Weitz Balanced

Fund.ManagerBio: Weitz is the founder of Weitz & Co. Prior to founding Weitz & Co. in 1983, he served as an account executive and securities analyst with G.A. Saxton & Co., Inc. (1970-1973) and with Chiles Heider & Co. (1973-1983). Weitz holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks capital appreciation. The fund invests primarily in common stocks and a variety of securities convertible into common stocks. It may invest in the securities of other investment companies, which may include exchange-traded funds and may invest in the equity securities of issuers of all sizes, including small capitalization companies (which are those with a market capitalization of less than $2 billion), which is to sound, growing, well-managed businesses. It may also invest in put and call options.It is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: Weitz Hickory

Fund.ManagerBio: Weitz is the founder of Weitz & Co. Prior to founding Weitz & Co. in 1983, he served as an account executive and securities analyst with G.A. Saxton & Co., Inc. (1970-1973) and with Chiles Heider & Co. (1973-1983). Weitz holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks capital appreciation. The fund invests primarily in common stocks and a variety of securities convertible into common stocks. It may invest in the securities of other investment companies, which may include exchange-traded funds and may invest in the equity securities of issuers of all sizes, including small capitalization companies .The fund may invest in commodities contracts and futures transactions such as stock index futures, may borrow money, purchase securities on margin and engage in short selling of securities.It may also invest in put and call options.It is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: Weitz Partners III Opportunity

Fund.ManagerBio: Weitz is the founder of Weitz & Co. Prior to founding Weitz & Co. in 1983, he served as an account executive and securities analyst with G.A. Saxton & Co., Inc. (1970-1973) and with Chiles Heider & Co. (1973-1983). Weitz holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.

It may invest in the securities of other investment companies, which may include exchange-traded funds and may invest in the equity securities of issuers of all sizes, including small capitalization companies (which are those with a market capitalization of less than $2 billion), which is to sound, growing, well-managed businesses. It may also invest in put and call options.It is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: Weitz Partners Value

Fund.ManagerBio: Carney has been a fixed income analyst and securities trader for Weitz & Co. since February, 1995. He was previously a municipal securities analyst with Smith Barney. Carney has a Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks high current income consistent with the preservation of capital. The fund normally invests at least 8 80% of the value of its assets in fixed income securities such as U.S. government and agency securities, corporate debt securities, mortgage-backed securities, preferred stock and taxable municipal bonds. It may invest up to 15% of its total assets in securities which are non-investment grade or unrated The Short-Intermediate Income Fund if advisor determines, and it normally not invest in fixed income securities which are rated below B by S&P or by Moody's or are currently in default.
Fund.Name: Weitz Short-Intermediate Income

Fund.ManagerBio: Weitz is the founder of Weitz & Co. Prior to founding Weitz & Co. in 1983, he served as an account executive and securities analyst with G.A. Saxton & Co., Inc. (1970-1973) and with Chiles Heider & Co. (1973-1983). Weitz holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks capital appreciation. The fund invests primarily in common stocks and a variety of securities convertible into common stocks. It may invest in the securities of other investment companies, which may include exchange-traded funds and may invest in the equity securities of issuers of all sizes, including small capitalization companies (which are those with a market capitalization of less than $2 billion), which is to sound, growing, well-managed businesses. It may also invest in put and call options.It is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: Weitz Value

Fund.ManagerBio: Taylor has been a portfolio manager with Wasatch Advisors since 1999. He joined the firm in 1996 as a securities analyst.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital. Income is a secondary consideration. The fund primarily invests in common stocks of growing companies with small to medium size market capitalizations of less than $5 billion. The advisor seeks companies that have significantly better prospects than most companies for long-term capital appreciation based on historical and projected rates of earnings growth or on development of new products and services. It may also invest in preferred stocks and convertibles or bonds with attached warrants. The fund may invest a portion of assets in foreign securities. The fund is non-diversified.
Fund.Name: Wasatch Core Growth

Fund.ManagerBio: Krishnan is a portfolio manager with Wasatch Advisors. He joined their research team 1994 as a securities analyst. He worked previously with P&B Laboratories and Viv Consultants. Krishnan holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital. The fund invests at least 80% of assets in equity securities of technology companies. It looks for companies that developed or invented leading technology. The fund may invest in preferred stocks, warrants and IPO's. This fund is non-diversified.
Fund.Name: Wasatch Global Science & Technology

Fund.ManagerBio: Prior to joining Wasatch Advisors in 2001, Mr. Bowen worked as an analyst with the Financial Institutions Regulatory Group of the law firm Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term capital growth. The fund will generally invest in companies with a market capitalization between $3 billion and $20 billion. The fund may also invest up to 20% of assets in foreign companies. It is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: Wasatch Heritage Growth

Fund.ManagerBio: Edgley is managing director, director of research and portfolio manager with Wanger Asset Management, his employer since 1994. Prior to joining the firm, he was an analyst with Crosby Securities. Edgley holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term capital appreciation. The fund normally invests in foreign growth companies. It will invest in at least three different developed, foreign country markets. The fund's portfolio of stocks will focus on small companies, though it may invest in companies of any size. The fund may also invest in emerging markets. It is non-diversified.
Fund.Name: Wasatch International Growth

Fund.ManagerBio: Edgley is managing director, director of research and portfolio manager with Wanger Asset Management, his employer since 1994. Prior to joining the firm, he was an analyst with Crosby Securities. Edgley holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital. The fund invests in foreign micro cap companies in at least three different developed countries. It may invest in emerging market countries. The fund does not limit investments to specific sectors. It may invest in technology and health care companies and may participate in initial public offerings. The fund is non-diversified.
Fund.Name: Wasatch International Opportunities

Fund.ManagerBio: Gardiner is a vice president and director of the Wasatch Advisors, Inc. He joined Wasatch Advisors as an equity analyst in 1987. Cardiner holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital. The fund normally invests at least 80% of assets in common stocks of companies with market capitalizations of less than $1 billion. It may also purchase investment-grade convertible securities. The fund may invest up to 15% of assets in foreign securities, and up to 5% of assets in companies that are in the process of reorganization or buyout. This fund is non-diversified.
Fund.Name: Wasatch Micro Cap

Fund.ManagerBio: Bythrow is a portfolio manager for Wasatch. He joined Wasatch in 2003. From 1998 to 2003, Bythrow worked in Indiana as a Portfolio Manager for the Monogram Special Equity Fund. Earlier, he was an Equity Analyst with Parkstone Funds and a Credit Analyst with Shoreline Bank, both in Michigan. Bythrow holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long term growth of capital. The fund normally invests at least 80% of the Fund's net assets in the common stocks of micro cap companies. It invests primarily in the common stocks of companies with market capitalizations of less than $750 million at the time of initial purchase. The fund may invest in technology and health care companies. It may also invest a large percentage of assets in a few sectors. The fund is non-diversified.
Fund.Name: Wasatch Micro Cap Value

Fund.ManagerBio: Cardon has been a securities analyst with Wasatch Advisors since 1980. He is also vice president and member of the board of directors of Wasatch Funds. Cardon holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation and is a member of the Salt Lake City Society of Financial Analysts.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital; income is a secondary consideration. The fund primarily invests common stocks of companies with market capitalizations of less than $1.5 billion. It may invest in preferreds and convertibles or bonds with attached warrants. The fund may also invest a portion of assets in foreign securities (not including ADRs), and in special situations, such as mergers or reorganizations. The fund is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: Wasatch Small Cap Growth

Fund.ManagerBio: Larkins is a portfolio manager with Wasatch Funds. He joined the company in 1995 as a securities analyst.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital; income is secondary. The fund primarily invest in common stocks of companies with market capitalizations less than $1.5 billion. Management selects stocks of companies that typically have low stock valuations, potential for improved earnings growth, strong management, history of profitable growth, and products or services that may increase market share. This fund is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: Wasatch Small Cap Value

Fund.ManagerBio: Stewart has served as president and director of funds at Wasatch Advisors since 1975. In addition, he is a professor of finance at the University of Utah, a post he assumed that same year. Previously, he spent a year as chief financial analyst with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Stewart holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation and a member of the American Economic Association and the Salt Lake Society of Financial Analysts.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to maaximize current income. A secondary objective is long-term growth of capital and income. The fund primarily invests income-producing domestic and foreign securities, including equity securities and fixed income securities. The fund concentrates its investments in real estate investment trusts.The fund is non-diversified.
Fund.Name: Wasatch Strategic Income

Fund.ManagerBio: Barker is a portfolio manager and senior research analyst with Wasatch Advisors, her employer since 1989. In 1995, she was elected to the firms board of directors. She also serves on the firms investment committee. Barker holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation in 1993. She is a member of the Salt Lake City Society of Financial Analysts.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital; income is a secondary consideration. The fund primarily invest in common stocks of small to mid-sized growth companies, considered to be those with capitalizations less than $5 billion, which management believes to have above-average prospects for long-term capital appreciation. It may also invest in convertibles, preferred stocks, government securities, and high-quality corporate bonds. The fund may invest a portion of assets in foreign securities, and up to in special situations, such as reorganizations and mergers. It is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: Wasatch Ultra Growth

Holding.Company: U S Treas Bd Stripped Prin Pmt
U S Treas Bd Stripped Prin Pmt
U S Treas Bd Stripped Prin Pmt

Fund.ManagerBio: No Biography
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to provide a rate of return that exceeds the rate of inflation over a business cycle, with an emphasis on both income and capital appreciation. The fund normally invests at least 90% of assets in U.S. Treasury securities and in repurchase agreements collateralized by such securities. It may invest the balance in high-quality money-market instruments, cash, and cash equivalents. The fund's effective duration usually ranges from less than one year to a maximum of 15 years; the average maturity typically ranges from less than one year to 30 years.
Fund.Name: Wasatch-Hoisington U.S. Treasury

Fund.ManagerBio: Morse has been president and chief executive officer of Morse Williams & Company since 1981.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks growth of capital, income is secondary. The fund invests in a diversified portfolio of common stocks considered by Wall Street Management Corporation to offer prospects of sustained growth in value.
Fund.Name: Wall Street

Fund.ManagerBio: Ogden is a vice president and portfolio manager for Waddell & Reed Ivy Investment Company and Waddell & Reed Investment Management Company. He joined Waddell & Reed in July 1994 as an investment analyst. He was named assistant portfolio manager in January 1999. He was appointed portfolio manager in January 2002. Prior to joining Waddell & Reed, Ogden was affiliated with Arthur Andersen & Company as a senior accountant and business advisor. Ogden holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks capital growth; current income is secondary. The fund invests primarily in common stocks of U.S. and, to a lesser extent, foreign companies. It may invest in companies of any size and of any industry to achieve its primary goal of growth. The fund may periodically emphasize a blend of value and growth potential in selecting stocks.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Accumulative A

Fund.ManagerBio: Ogden is a vice president and portfolio manager for Waddell & Reed Ivy Investment Company and Waddell & Reed Investment Management Company. Prior to joining Waddell & Reed, Ogden was affiliated with Arthur Andersen & Company as a senior accountant and business advisor. Ogden holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.

Fund.ManagerBio: Avery joined Waddell & Reed as director of investment research in August 1987 and began managing portfolios for the company in 1994. He was also an assistant vice president and senior investment analyst with the company from 1981 to June 1986, after which he spent a year as a vice president of investor relations with Torchmark Corporation. Avery also spent three years as an assistant investment officer with Mercantile Trust Company.
Fund.FundSummary: Waddell & Reed Advisor Asset Strategy Fund seeks total return while minimizing risk. The fund generally invests approximately 70% of assets in stocks, 25% in bonds, and 5% in short-term instruments. The advisor reallocates assets to favor investments that it believes provide the best opportunity for total return; single reallocations usually do not involve more than 10% of assets. It may invest assets in foreign securities.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Asset Strategy A

Fund.ManagerBio: Avery joined Waddell & Reed as director of investment research in August 1987 and began managing portfolios for the company in 1994. He was also an assistant vice president and senior investment analyst with the company from 1981 to June 1986, after which he spent a year as a vice president of investor relations with Torchmark Corporation. Avery also spent three years as an assistant investment officer with Mercantile Trust Company.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks high total return over the long term. The fund generally invests approximately 70% of assets in a blend of growth and value stocks, 25% in bonds, and 5% in short-term instruments. Bonds securities may include varieties of fixed-income instruments, such as corporate or U.S. government debt securities, with remaining maturities of more than three years.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Asset Strategy B

Fund.ManagerBio: Avery joined Waddell & Reed as director of investment research in August 1987 and began managing portfolios for the company in 1994. Avery also spent three years as an assistant investment officer with Mercantile Trust Company.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks high total return over the long term. Fund.ManagerBio: Cusser serves as vice president and portfolio manager with Waddell & Reed Investment Management, his employer since August 1992. Previously, he spent 12 years as a fixed-income strategist for Kidder, Peabody & Company. Prior to that, he worked as manager of fixed-income research at General Electric Investment Corporation, as a rating officer at Standard & Poors, and as an analyst at the First Boston Corporation. Cusser holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks a reasonable return with an emphasis on capital preservation. The fund normally invest at least 80% of net assets in bonds. The fund has no limitations regarding the maturity, duration or dollar weighted average of its holdings. The fund may invest in debt securities with varying maturities and can invest in securities of companies of any size.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Bond A

Fund.ManagerBio: Prince-Fox is a senior vice president of Waddell & Reed Ivy Investment Company. Prince-Fox joined Waddell & Reed in 1983 as an equity investment analyst. She first assumed portfolio management responsibility in January 1991.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks current income; capital appreciation is secondary. The fund invests mainly in income-producing securities that include common stocks and debt securities. It generally owns equity securities of medium to large, well-established companies which are usually dividend-producing securities. Generally, the fund's debt securities are either U.S. government securities or investment-grade corporate bonds. The fund may also invest, to a lesser extent, in foreign securities.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Continental Inc A

Fund.ManagerBio: Prince-Fox is a senior vice president of Waddell & Reed Ivy Investment Company. Prince-Fox joined Waddell & Reed in 1983 as an equity investment analyst. She first assumed portfolio management responsibility in January 1991.
Fund.FundSummary: Waddell & Reed Advisor Continental Income seeks current income; capital appreciation is secondary. The fund invests mainly in three kinds of securities: debt, common stocks, and preferred stocks. It may also purchase convertibles. Normally, it invests at least 65% of assets in income-producing securities; it usually invests at least 25% of assets in debt or preferred stocks, and no more than 75% in common stocks. It may invest up to 5% of assets in debt rated below BBB.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Continental Inc B

Fund.ManagerBio: Prince-Fox is a senior vice president of Waddell & Reed Ivy Investment Company. Prince-Fox joined Waddell & Reed in 1983 as an equity investment analyst. She first assumed portfolio management responsibility in January 1991.

Fund.ManagerBio: Wineland is currently a senior vice president at Waddell & Reed, his employer since 1984. He is also a member of the common-stock policy committee. Prior to joining the company, he was a finished-products distribution manager with Proctor and Gamble Paper Products. Previously, he spent five years with the U.S. Army. He has 11 years of investment experience. Wineland holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks current income. The fund normally invests at least 80% of net assets in equity securities, primarily in common stocks of large cap U.S. and foreign companies with dominant market positions in their industries. The fund invests in securities that have the potential for capital appreciation or that WRIMCO expects to resist market decline. Although the fund typically invests in large companies, it may invest in securities of any size company. The fund may invest up to 20% of net assets in foreign securities.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Core Investment A

Ginther has been an employee of WRIMCO since 1995. Ginther holds the Certified Public Accountant designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term capital appreciation. The fund normally invests at least 80% of assets in securities, primarily equities of both U.S. and non-U.S. companies principally engaged in exploration, discovery, distribution or infrastructure of energy and/or alternative energy. It will invest in securities of companies without regard to market capitalization and in companies domiciled in the U.S. and foreign countries, including, potentially, companies domiciled or traded in emerging markets.

Fund.ManagerBio: Vrabac is a senior vice president of WRIMCO and IICO, vice president of the fund and vice president of other investment companies for which WRIMCO and IICO serve as investment manager. Vrabac is also the head of Fixed Income for WRIMCO and IICO. Vrabac has been an employee of WRIMCO since May 1994.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks diversified portfolio of primarily U.S. dollar-denominated debt securities of foreign and U.S. issuers. The fund may invest up to 35% of total assets in lower quality bonds. It typically invest in junk bonds of foreign issuers. The fund may also invest in equity securities of foreign and U.S. issuers to achieve its secondary objective of capital growth. It may invest up to 100% of net asset in securities denominated in currencies other than the U.S. dollar.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Global Bond A

Fund.ManagerBio: Vrabac is a senior vice president of WRIMCO and IICO, vice president of the fund and vice president of other investment companies for which WRIMCO and IICO serve as investment manager. Vrabac is also the head of Fixed Income for WRIMCO and IICO. Vrabac has been an employee of WRIMCO since May 1994.

Fund.ManagerBio: Cusser serves as vice president and portfolio manager with Waddell & Reed Investment Management, his employer since August 1992. Previously, he spent 12 years as a fixed-income strategist for Kidder, Peabody & Company. Prior to that, he worked as manager of fixed-income research at General Electric Investment Corporation, as a rating officer at Standard & Poors, and as an analyst at the First Boston Corporation. Cusser holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks seek as high a current income as is consistent with safety of principal. The fund invests in debt securities issued or guaranteed by the U.S. government or one of its agencies or instrumentalities. It may enter into repurchase agreements, purchase securities on a when-issued or delayed-delivery basis, and buy and write put and call options.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Government Secs A

Fund.ManagerBio: Rieke is vice president and portfolio manager with Waddell & Reed Investment Management Company, her employer since 1971. Prior to joining the fixed-income department of the company, she worked as a research assistant to the staff economist and as a statistician. Rieke holds the designation of Chartered Financial Analyst and Certified Public Accountant ..
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks current income; capital growth is a secondary consideration. The fund normally invests at least 80% of assets in income-producing securities, focusing on higher-yielding debt securities rated BB or lower. It may invest up to 20% of assets in common stocks in order to seek capital growth. It emphasizes a blend of value and growth in its selection of common stocks. The fund may invest without limit in foreign securities.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv High-Income A

Fund.ManagerBio: Mengel has been an employee of WRIMCO and has held his responsibilities for International Growth Portfolio since May 1996. He is senior vice president of WRIMCO and IICO, vice president of the Fund and vice president of other investment companies for which WRIMCO or IICO serves as investment manager.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term capital appreciation; income is secondary. The fund primarily invests in common stocks of foreign companies that have the potential for long-term growth represented by economic expansion within a country or region, as well as the privatization and/or restructuring of particular industries. It primarily invests in issuers of developed countries, and the fund may invest in companies of any size.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv International Gr A

Fund.ManagerBio: Sterner is a vice president with Waddell & Reed Investment Management Company, his employer since 1992. Prior to joining Waddell & Reed, he spent seven years as an executive vice president and chief investment officer of the trust division at The Merchants Bank. Previously, he spent six years as an executive vice president and manager of the financial-services division at Traders Bank. Sterner holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks current income. The fund will normally invest in investment-grade debt securities of U.S. issuers. It seeks to identify relative value opportunities between these sectors of the fixed income market. The fund maintains a dollar-weighted average maturity of not less than one year and not more than five years, and the fund may invest in companies of any size.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Limited Term Bond A

Fund.ManagerBio: Bailey serves as vice president and portfolio manager with Waddell & Reed Management, his employer since July 1993. Bailey holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: Waddell & Reed Advisor Municipal Bond Fund seeks income exempt from federal taxation. The fund normally invests at least 80% of assets in investment-grade municipal bonds. It does not maintain restrictions on average weighted maturity. The fund may treat no more than 40% of its dividend payouts as preference items for the Alternative Minimum Tax. It may invest up to 10% of assets in other taxable obligations. The fund may also invest in debt futures and municipal-bond index futures.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Municipal Bond A

Fund.ManagerBio: Scott is vice president with Waddell & Reed Investment Management Co, which she joined in April 1999 as an investment analyst. She worked previously as an equity analyst at Bartlett & Company from 1994 through 1999. She served as an investment analyst with WRIMCO from April 1999 to February 2001. Scott holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks capital growth. The fund normally invests in common stocks of mid cap U.S. and, to a lesser extent, foreign companies that WRIMCO believes offer above-average growth potential. Mid cap companies are typically companies with market capitalizations that range between $1 billion and $15 billion.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv New Concepts A

Fund.ManagerBio: Hooper is a vice president and portfolio manager with Waddell & Reed Investment Management Company. He was previously affliated with the Waddell & Reed from 1984 to 1991. He joined the company as a portfolio manager of institutional client accouts. Prior to rejoining Waddell & Reed in April 1999, he was chief investment officer and director of Owen Joseph Asset Management Company.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks the highest long-term total return consistent with reasonable safety of capital. The fund may invest in securities including common stock and, to a lesser extent, in debt securities of U.S. and foreign issuers. The fund generally owns common stock of medium to large, well-established companies while typically emphasizing a blend of value and growth potential. Typically, the fund's debt securities are either U.S. government securities or investment-grade corporate bonds. The fund may not invest more than 10% of its total assets in foreign securities.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Retrm Shares A

Fund.ManagerBio: Hooper is a vice president and portfolio manager with Waddell & Reed Investment Management Company. He was previously affliated with the Waddell & Reed from 1984 to 1991. Fund.FundSummary: Waddell & Reed Advisors Retirement Shares seeks the highest long-term total return consistent with reasonable safety of capital. The fund may invest in securities including common stock, preferred stock, debt securities and convertible securities. It may invest in debt securities rated in any rating category of the established rating services, including securities rated in the lowest category. The fund may also purchase mortgage-backed securities issued by both government and non-government entities.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Retrm Shares C

Fund.ManagerBio: Shafran is senior vice president of IICO and WRIMCO, vice president of Ivy Funds, Inc. and vice president of other investment companies for which WRIMCO serves as investment manager. Shafran has served as a portfolio manager for investment companies managed by WRIMCO since January 1996. He served as an investment analyst with WRIMCO and its predecessor from June 1990 to January 1996.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term capital growth. The fund normally invests at least 80% of assets in science- and technology-related securities issued by companies that may benefit from the application of scientific or technological developments. Science and technology companies are companies whose products, processes or services are being or are expected to be significantly benefited by the use or commercial application of scientific or technological developments or discoveries. The fund may also invest in companies that utilize science and/or technology to improve their existing business even though the business is not within the science and technology industries. The fund may invest in companies of any size and may invest up to 20% of its net assets in foreign securities.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Science & Tech A

The fund emphasizes relatively new or unseasoned companies in their early stages of development or smaller companies positioned in new or emerging industries where there is opportunity for rapid growth.

Small Cap Category (small cap stocks). Fund.ManagerBio: Ogden is a vice president and portfolio manager for Waddell & Reed Ivy Investment Company and Waddell & Reed Investment Management Company. He joined Waddell & Reed in July 1994 as an investment analyst. He was named assistant portfolio manager in January 1999. He was appointed portfolio manager in January 2002. Prior to joining Waddell & Reed, Ogden was affiliated with Arthur Andersen & Company as a senior accountant and business advisor. Ogden holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital while minimizing capital gains and income to shareholders. The fund invests primarily in a diversified portfolio of common stocks of U.S. companies and, to a lesser extent, foreign companies that WRIMCO considers to be high in quality and attractive in their long-term investment potential. Under normal market conditions, the fund invests at least 80% of net assets in equity securities, primarily common stocks and securities convertible into common stocks. The fund seeks stocks that are favorably priced in relation to their fundamental value and will likely grow over time. The fund may invest in companies of any size, any industry or any country in order to achieve its objective.
Fund.Name: Waddell & Reed Adv Tax Managed Eq A

The Portfolio invests, primarily, in a combination of Waddell & Reed Advisors equity mutual funds that have a long-term growth orientation. It also invests, to a lesser extent, in Waddell & Reed Advisors bond and income-producing mutual funds. Each underlying fund, in turn, invests in a diversified portfolio of securities. Fund.ManagerBio: Mahler is the president of the W.P. Stewart & Co. Growth Fund. He served as head of Equities at Brown Brothers Harriman & Company from January 2004 to November 2005 and was director of Research from October 2001 to December 2003. Prior to joining Brown Brothers, Mahler served at Manning and Napier Advisors, Inc. as co-director of Research and senior analyst portfolio manager from January 2000 to September 2001 and March 1997 to December 1999, respectively.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks Capital gains. The fund typically invests in common stocks of companies based on a variety offactors. It primarily invests in large-market capitalization companies, which arecompanies that have market capitalizations of $5 billion or more(large-cap). The fund's portfolio normally consists primarily ofcommon stocks of U.S.-based companies listed on the New YorkStock Exchange. It is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: W.P. Stewart & Co Growth

Fund.ManagerBio: Gibs founded Volumetric Advisers in 1985, and currently serves as president. He uses proprietary volume analysis in making investment decisions regarding stock selection, sales, and market timing. Gibs spent 1975 to 1986 as a market development manager and chemist for Lonza Inc., and seven years before that as a research chemist for St. Regis Paper Company.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks capital growth. The fund primarily invests in common stocks traded on the New York Stock Exchange. The advisor selects stocks on the basis of its own market-timing formula. The Volumetric Trading System is based on the quantitative analysis of demand and supply for stocks by volume. The fund holds most of its stocks for three to 15 months. It may not purchase securities on margin or engage in the purchase of call, put, or other options. For temporary defensive purposes, the fund may hold up to 100% of assets in cash equivalents and invesment-grade debt securities.
Fund.Name: Volumetric

Fund.ManagerBio: Lorenzen is a president of IMG and has served as chief investment officer since 2003, his employer since 1992. He is also a member of IMGs Investment Policy Committee. Prior to his current position, Lorenzen spent three years with The Statesman Group as a securities analyst and corporate fixed-income analyst. Lorenzen holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks income consistent with preservation of capital; capital appreciation is secondary. The fund normally invests at least 75% of assets in investment-grade debt. It usually invests at least 65% in bonds, including corporate and U.S. government debt, mortgage-backed securities, and foreign debt. It may hold up to 15% in foreign issues.
Fund.Name: Vintage Bond

Fund.ManagerBio: Lorenzen is a president of IMG and has served as chief investment officer since 2003, his employer since 1992. He is also a member of IMGs Investment Policy Committee. Prior to his current position, Lorenzen spent three years with The Statesman Group as a securities analyst and corporate fixed-income analyst. Lorenzen holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks total return from a portfolio of limited-term fixed-income securities.. The fund primarily invests in bonds, notes, and debentures of a wide range of fixed-income security issuers. It normally invests more than 65% of assets in fixed-income securities rated within the three highest rating categories or of comparable quality. The fund maintains a dollar weighted average portfolio maturity of 1 to 4 years.
Fund.Name: Vintage Limited Term Bond

Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks income exempt from federal income taxes, consistent with preservation of capital. The fund normally invests 80% of assets in high-quality municipal obligations. It generally invests in securities with maturities of 25 years or less, and maintains an average weighted portfolio maturity of 4 to 10 years. The fund invests 25% of assets in municipal securities related in that business or political developments or changed affecting one security could also affect the others. It may invest 10% of assets in municipal obligations of comparable quality to rated securities.
Fund.Name: Vintage Municipal Bond

Fund.ManagerBio: Young is a portfolio manager and a member of St. Denis J. Villere & Co., LLC. He has managed investment advisory accounts for the firm since 1986. Young is the nephew of George Villere and St. Denis Villere and the cousin of St. Denis Villere III.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term capital growth consistent with perservation of capital and balanced by current income. The fund invests in a combination of common stocks of domestic companies with a minimum market capitalization of $150 million, as well as high quality fixed income obligations. It invests 60% to 70% of assets in equity securities selected primarily for their growth potential and 30% to 40% of assets in equity and fixed income securities selected primarily for their income potential. Fixed income securities will primarily be investment grade, with maturities generally ranging from three to ten years, with an average maturity of approximately seven years.
Fund.Name: Villere Balanced

Fund.ManagerBio: Skirkanich is the founder of Fox Asset Management and serves as the investment committee chairman for both equity and fixed-income. He was formerly a managing director of Dreman Value Management, Inc. Prior to that, Skirkanich was a vice president of investments at Kidder, Peabody & Company and Shearspn American Express, where he managed individual, corporate taxable and tax-exempt accounts for twelve years. He began his investment career as an analyst with Prudential Bache Securities.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term total return and capital preservation. The fund typically invests at least 80% in equity securities of large-capitalization companies. It currently defines large-cap companies as companies with total market value of at least $3 billion. The fund invests primarily in the equity securities of U.S. companies that are leaders in their industries. It usually may invest up to 20% of net assets in sponsored ADRs. ADRs are typically issued by a U.S. bank or trust company and evidence ownership of underlying securities issued by a foreign corporation.
Fund.Name: Viking Large-Cap Value

Fund.ManagerBio: Pierides is a portfolio manager with Fox Asset Management. He has been engaged in the securities business since 1983 as an analyst and money manager. Pierides is a member of NYSS and AIMR. He published The Small-Cap Myth (Barrons, 12 04 1995) and High Reward for Low Risk (Barrons, 10-14-1996).
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term total return and capital preservation. The fund typically invests at least 80% in equity securities of small-capitalization companies. It currently defines small-cap companies as companies with total market value of no more than $2 billion at the time the fund first invests in them. The fund invests primarily in the equity securities of U.S. companies that are dominant in their respective industry niches. It usually may invest up to 20% of net assets in sponsored ADRs.
Fund.Name: Viking Small-Cap Value

The fund usually invests at least 80% in municipal securities that pay interest free from federal income taxes and Montana personal income taxes. The fund may generally invest up to 20% of net assets in private activity bonds, and it may invest more than 25% in net assets in municipal securities. The fund is non-diversified.

Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks current income as well as long-term capital appreciation. The fund invests at least 80% of assets in securities convertible into common stocks, such as convertible bonds, convertible notes and convertible preferred stocks. Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks total return that is consistent with preservation of capital. The fund invests at least 80% of total assets in bonds of varying maturities. It invests at least 65% of total assets in debt securities with more than one year to maturity, and its maximum average portfolio maturity is three years. The fund may invest up to 10% of total assets in debt securities rated below investment grade and 15% of total assets in foreign securities, including up to 5% of total assets in emerging markets debt and up to 10% of assets in securities denominated in foreign currencies.
Fund.Name: Vantagepoint Short-Term Bond

Fund.ManagerBio: Harkins, Vice President, Equities, has served as Vice President, Director and Senior Analyst in the Investment Division of VIA for the last five years and has lead the Team for the last four years.
Fund.FundSummary: Vantagepoint Traditional Growth Fund seeks capital growth and reasonable current income. The fund invests in certain other Vantagepoint mutual funds, rather than investing directly in individual securities. It primarily invests in the following underlying funds: Short-Term Bond, Core Bond Index, Equity Income, Growth & Income, Growth, Aggressive Opportunities and International. It may invest up to 60% of its assets in stock funds and 40% of its assets in fixed-income funds.
Fund.Name: Vantagepoint Traditional Growth

Fund.ManagerBio: Bennett has been a director of Mellon Capital Management Corporation since 2000. He joined Mellon Capital in 1997 as a vice president and fixed income strategist. Prior to joining Mellon Capital, Bennett was a fixed income strategist at Merrill Lynch. He has 19 years of finance and investment experience. Bennett holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks current income. The fund invests at least 80% of net assets in securities issued by the U.S. Treasury, U.S. Government agency, and U.S. Government-sponsored enterprises, including mortgage-backed securities issued or guaranteed by the Government National Mortgage Association, the Federal National Mortgage Association, and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation.
Fund.Name: Vantagepoint U.S. Government Sec

Fund.ManagerBio: Buek is a principal and portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1987. Buek holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of large-capitalization stocks. The fund employs a passive management investment approach designed to track the performance of the Standard & Poor's 500 index, a widely recognized benchmark of U.S. stock market performance that is dominated by the stocks of large U.S. companies. It invests all, or substantially all, of assets in the stocks that make up the index, holding each stock in approximately the same proportion as its weighting in the index.
Fund.Name: Vanguard 500 Index

Fund.ManagerBio: Buek is a principal and portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1987. Buek holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of large-capitalization stocks. The fund employs a passive management investment approach designed to track the performance of the Standard & Poor's 500 index, a widely recognized benchmark of U.S. stock market performance that is dominated by the stocks of large U.S. companies. It invests all, or substantially all, of assets in the stocks that make up the index, holding each stock in approximately the same proportion as its weighting in the index.
Fund.Name: Vanguard 500 Index Adm

Fund.ManagerBio: Loeb is co-chairman and chief executive officer with Mellon Capital Management, a company he co-founded in 1983. He has more than 29 years of investment experience, working with both Mellon Capital and Wells Fargo.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to maximize long-term total return. The fund allocates assets among common stocks, bonds, and money-market instruments. It varies the asset mix according to the relative attractiveness of the asset classes; there is no limitation as to the amount of assets in each class. The advisor evaluates common stocks using a dividend-discount model, a mathematical model that evaluates stocks according to the projected worth of their dividends. The bond portion consists primarily of long-term U.S. Treasuries or securities issued by other government agencies.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Asset Allocation

Fund.ManagerBio: Loeb is co-chairman and chief executive officer with Mellon Capital Management, a company he co-founded in 1983. He has more than 29 years of investment experience, working with both Mellon Capital and Wells Fargo.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to maximize long-term total return. The fund allocates assets among common stocks, bonds, and money-market instruments. It varies the asset mix according to the relative attractiveness of the asset classes; there is no limitation as to the amount of assets in each class. The advisor evaluates common stocks using a dividend-discount model, a mathematical model that evaluates stocks according to the projected worth of their dividends. The bond portion consists primarily of long-term U.S. Treasuries or securities issued by other government agencies.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Asset Allocation Adm

Fund.ManagerBio: Davis
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks growth and income. The fund normally invests 60% of assets in equities and 40% in bonds. The equity portion seeks to replicate the Wilshire 5000 Index performance; to this end, the fund invests primarily in the 500 largest companies on the index and samples the rest. The fixed-income portion seeks to replicate the Lehman Brothers Aggregate Bond Index performance; it may purchase investment-grade U.S. government obligations, corporate debt, and mortgage-backed securities to secure this goal.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Balanced Index

Fund.ManagerBio: Davis

Smith holds a Chartered Financial Analyst designation and Certified Financial Planner, he is a member of both the Association for Investment Mgmt. and Research and the Investment Analysts Society of Philadelphia.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to provide a higher level of current income than shorter-term bonds, but with less share-price fluctuation than longer-term bonds. The fund invests primarily in high-quality municipal bonds issued by California state and local governments and regional governmental authorities. It may invest at least 80% of assets in securities that are exempt from federal and California taxes. The fund's dollar-weighted average nominal maturity is expected to be between 6 and 12 years. It is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: Vanguard CA Interm-Trm Tax-Exempt

Fund.ManagerBio: Kolokotrones is a president and co-founder of PRIMECAP Management Company. He co-founded PRIMECAP Management Company in September 1983. Previously, Kolokotrones spent six years at Capital Research Company. He has held portfolio management responsibilities since 1979. From 1970 to 1977, Kolokotrones was vice president and senior financial analyst at Smith Barney, Harris Upham and Company in New York.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term total return. The fund invests primarily in U.S. stocks, with an emphasis on companies that have prospects for rapid earnings growth. It may invest foreign stocks and has flexibility to engage in certain hedging and defensive techniques, such as short-selling stocks, purchasing put options, and temporarily increasing cash investments.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Capital Opportunity

Fund.ManagerBio: Kolokotrones is a president and co-founder of PRIMECAP Management Company. He co-founded PRIMECAP Management Company in September 1983. Previously, Kolokotrones spent six years at Capital Research Company. He has held portfolio management responsibilities since 1979. From 1970 to 1977, Kolokotrones was vice president and senior financial analyst at Smith Barney, Harris Upham and Company in New York.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term total return. The fund invests primarily in U.S. stocks, with an emphasis on companies that have prospects for rapid earnings growth. It may invest foreign stocks and has flexibility to engage in certain hedging and defensive techniques, such as short-selling stocks, purchasing put options, and temporarily increasing cash investments.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Capital Opportunity Adm

Fund.ManagerBio: Fassnacht is partner and senior vice president of Wellington Management, his employer since 1991. Fassnacht holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks maximum long-term total return. The fund invests in stocks across the capitalization spectrum that are considered undervalued. It seeks companies that are out of favor with investors and that are trading at prices below what the stocks are worth compared to potential earnings. The companies often have lower price\earnings ratios and higher dividend yields.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Capital Value

Fund.ManagerBio: No biography.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of consumer discretionary stocks. The fund employs a passive management investment approach designed to track the performance of the MSCI U.S. Investable Market Consumer Discretionary Index. This index consists of stocks of large, medium, and small U.S. companies within the consumer discretionary sector. Its manufacturing and service segments include automotive, household durable goods, textiles and hotels, restaurants and other leisure facilities.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Consumer Discretionary Idx Adm

Fund.ManagerBio: No biography.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of consumer staples stocks. The Fund employs a passive management investment approach designed to track the performance of the MSCI U.S. Investable Market Consumer Staples Index. This index consists of stocks of large, medium-size, and small U.S. companies within the consumer staples sector. It includes manufacturers and distributors of food, beverages, and tobacco, as well as producers of nondurable household goods and personal products.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Consumer Staples Index Adm

Fund.ManagerBio: Keele is a principal with Oaktree Capital Management, a company he co-founded. Between 1986 and 1995, he served as a managing director with TCW Group. Prior to that, he was a vice president with NationsBank from 1981 to 1986. Keele earned his Chartered Financial Analyst designation in 1984.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks a high level of current income and long-term capital appreciation. The fund normally invests at least 80% of assets in convertible securities, the majority of which will be rated B or better. It may invest the balance in non-convertible corporate debt, U.S. government debt, common stocks, and money markets. The fund may invest up to 20% of assets in foreign securities.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Convertible Securities

Fund.ManagerBio: This is assigned to investments in which no person or team manages the fund.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of the MSCI EAFE index. The fund normally invests in the Vanguard European Stock Index and Pacific Stock Index Funds. Vanguard European Stock Index Fund intends to track the MSCI Europe index while Pacific Stock Index Fund attempts to replicate the returns of the MSCI Pacific Free index; both MSCI indices comprise the MSCI EAFE index. It may invest in options, futures, and other derivative instruments.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Developed Markets Index

Fund.ManagerBio: Kelly is a principal and portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1989.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term capital appreciation and dividend income. The fund invests at least 80% of assets in the equities of large capitalization companies and 20% in small to mid-capitalization companies. It may invest in derivatives to a limited extent. The fund may at times choose to invest in money market instruments, depending on the market conditions.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Diversified Equity Inv

Fund.ManagerBio: Ludt is a portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1997. He is Principal of Vanguard. Ludt has managed stock portfolios since 2000 and has managed the fund since its inception.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of a Mergent Dividend Achievers Select index that measures the investment return of common stocks that have a record of increasing dividends over time. The fund attempts to replicate the target index by investing all, or substantially all, of assets in the stocks that make up the index, holding each stock in approximately the same proportion as weighting in the index.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Dividend Appreciation Idx Inv

Fund.ManagerBio: Kilbride is vice president of Wellington Management. He has been with Wellington Management since 2002 and has managed the Fund since 2006.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks above-average current income and long-term growth of capital and income. The fund invests in stocks that tend to offer current dividends. It focuses on high-quality companies that have prospects for long-term total returns as a result of their ability to grow earnings and their willingness to increase dividends over time.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Dividend Growth

Fund.ManagerBio: Kelly is a principal and portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1989.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of the Select Emerging Markets Free index. The fund employs a passively managed investment approach by investing all or substantially all of its assets in a representative sample of the common stocks included in the Selected Emerging Markets Free index. This index includes approximately 500 common stocks of companies located in emerging markets around the world.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Emerging Mkts Stock Idx

Fund.ManagerBio: Kelly is a principal and portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1989.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of the Select Emerging Markets Free index. The fund employs a passively managed investment approach by investing all or substantially all of its assets in a representative sample of the common stocks included in the Selected Emerging Markets Free index. This index includes approximately 500 common stocks of companies located in emerging markets around the world.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Emerging Mkts Stock Idx Inst

Fund.ManagerBio: Bevilacqua, senior vice president and equity portfolio manager of Wellington Management, joined the firm in 1994.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital. The fund invests at least 80% of assets in the common stocks of companies principally engaged in energy-related activities, such as production and transmission of energy or energy fuels; the making of component products for such activities; energy research; and energy conservation or pollution control.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Energy

Fund.ManagerBio: Bevilacqua, senior vice president and equity portfolio manager of Wellington Management, joined the firm in 1994.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital. The fund invests at least 80% of assets in the common stocks of companies principally engaged in energy-related activities, such as production and transmission of energy or energy fuels; the making of component products for such activities; energy research; and energy conservation or pollution control.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Energy Adm

Fund.ManagerBio: Buek is a principal and portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1987. Buek holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of the MSCI U.S. Investable Market Energy Index. The fund employs an indexing investment approach to track the index, an index of stocks of U.S. companies within the energy sector, as classified under the Global Industry Classification Standard. The fund attempts to replicate the index by investing all, or substantially all, of its assets in the stocks that make up the index.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Energy Index Adm

Fund.ManagerBio: Ryan joined Wellington Management Company in 1981 and currently serves as senior vice president. He worked for Kollmorgen Corporation from 1974 to 1979, and for General Electric from 1971 to 1972. Ryan has 18 years of investment management experience serving institutional investors. Ryan holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks above-average level of current income and reasonable capital appreciation. The fund primarily invests in common stocks of medium-sized and large companies whose stocks pay above-average levels of dividend income and are considered to have the potential for capital appreciation.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Equity-Income

Fund.ManagerBio: Ryan joined Wellington Management Company in 1981 and currently serves as senior vice president. Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks above-average level of current income and reasonable capital appreciation. Fund.ManagerBio: Kelly is a principal and portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1989.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of the MSCI Europe index. The fund seeks to replicate the performance of the index, a market-cap-weighted index of more than 550 stocks in 16 European countries, through portfolio optimization, a statistical sampling technique. It intends to remain fully invested in common stocks.
Fund.Name: Vanguard European Stock Index

Fund.ManagerBio: Kelly is a principal and portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1989.

Fund.ManagerBio: Granahan is president of Granahan Investment Management, a position he has held since 1985. Previously, he spent five years as president of Granahan-Everitt Investments and 17 years with Wellington Management Company. He is a member of the Association for Investment Management and Research.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to provide long-term capital appreciation. The fund invests mainly in the stocks of small companies. These companies tend to be unseasoned but are considered by the Fund's advisors to have superior growth potential. These companies often provide little or no dividend income.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Explorer

Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of small- and mid-capitalization stocks. The fund employs a passive management strategy designed to track the performance of the Standard & Poor's Completion index, a broadly diversified index of stocks of small and medium-size U.S. companies, which consists of all the U.S. common stocks traded regularly on the NYSE, AMEX, or OTC markets. It typically invests substantially all of assets in the 1,200 largest stocks in its target index, thus covering nearly 80% of the Index's total market capitalization.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Extended Market Idx

Fund.ManagerBio: No biography.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index. The fund employs a passive management investment approach designed to track the performance of the MSCI U.S. Investable Market Financials index. This index consists of stocks of large, medium-size, and small U.S. companies within the financials sector. This sector is made up of companies involved in activities such as banking, mortgage finance, consumer finance, specialized finance, investment banking and brokerage, asset management and custody, corporate lending, insurance, financial investment, and real estate.

Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks tax-free current income. The fund normally invests at least 80% of assets in insured Florida municipal securities, exclusive of Florida Alternative Minimum Tax bonds, the principal and interest on which is insured by a private insurance company. It may invest the balance in uninsured Florida municipal securities rated at least AA, and certain taxable securities including U.S. government securities and Alternative Minimum Tax-subject bonds. The dollar-weighted average portfolio maturity typically ranges between 12 and 25 years. The fund is nondiversified.

Fund.ManagerBio: Perre is a principal and portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1990.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of the FTSE4Good US Select Index. The fund employs a passive management strategy designed to replicate the performance of the FTSE4Good US Select Index. It normally invests at least 95% of assets in the stocks of the index. The index is comprised of large and mid-cap stocks that have been screened for certain social and environmental criteria by the index sponsor, which is independent of Vanguard. The fund may invest, to a limited extent, in derivatives that are not screened based on social or environmental criteria. It is nondiversified.

Fund.ManagerBio: Arah is a director of Marathon-London. He has worked in investment management since 1982; has managed assets at Marathon-London since 1987.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term capital appreciation. The fund invests primarily in U.S. and foreign stocks chosen mainly on the basis of bottom-up stock analysis. It typically invests across a wide range of industries, and its holdings are expected to represent a mix of value and growth stocks, as well as a mix of developed and emerging markets stocks. The fund uses multiple investment advisors.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Global Equity

Fund.ManagerBio: Pappas is a vice president with Wellington Management Company, his employer since 1987. He currently chairs the mortgage-backed securities and core-bond strategy groups at Wellington. Previously, Pappas spent two years with New England Mutual Life Insurance Company. Pappas holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to provide a moderate level of current income. The fund normally invests at least 80% of assets in Government National Mortgage Association certificates. It may invest the balance of assets in other U.S. government obligations, as well as in repurchase agreements secured by U.S. government securities.
Fund.Name: Vanguard GNMA

Fund.ManagerBio: Pappas is a vice president with Wellington Management Company, his employer since 1987. He currently chairs the mortgage-backed securities and core-bond strategy groups at Wellington. Previously, Pappas spent two years with New England Mutual Life Insurance Company. Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to provide a moderate level of current income. The fund normally invests at least 80% of assets in Government National Mortgage Association certificates. Fund.Name: Vanguard GNMA Adm

Fund.ManagerBio: Cone is the chief executive officer, president and portfolio maanger of Franklin Portfolio Associates, his employer since 1982. He has an extensive background in computer modeling and quantitative methods. He is also a member of the Boston Security Analysts Society and the Chicago Quantitative Alliance, and the Q Group. Additionally, he is on the Advisory Board of the Center for Computational Finance and Economic Systems at Rice University. Cone holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks a total return greater than that of the S&P 500 Index on an annual basis. The fund invests at least 65% (and typically more than 90%) of assets in securities included in the S&P 500 Index. It is expected that the aggregate investment characteristics of the fund will be similar to the S&P 500 Index in terms of dividend yield, price/earnings ratio, return on equity, and price/book ratio.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Growth & Income

Additionally, he is on the Advisory Board of the Center for Computational Finance and Economic Systems at Rice University. Cone holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks a total return greater than that of the S&P 500 Index on an annual basis. The fund invests at least 65% (and typically more than 90%) of assets in securities included in the S&P 500 Index. It is expected that the aggregate investment characteristics of the fund will be similar to the S&P 500 Index in terms of dividend yield, price/earnings ratio, return on equity, and price/book ratio.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Growth & Income Adm

Fund.ManagerBio: Turner joined Turner in 1990. previously, he worked as vice president for First Maryland Asset Management from 1987 tp 198+. From 1985 to 1987 he worked at Merril Lynch Asset Management. From 1982 to 1987, he served with Wachovia Investment Management.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks capital appreciation. The fund normally invests at least 65% of assets in mid and large capitalization common stocks of U.S. companies that are reasonably valued and have strong earnings potential. The advisor seeks to maintain sector concentrations that approximate those of the Russell 1000 Growth index; it also seeks to diversify the fund by spreading investments over a broad range of industries. It may also invest up to 10% of assets in American depositary receipts.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Growth Equity

Fund.ManagerBio: OReilly is a principal and portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1992. He has managed stock index portfolios since 1994.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of large-capitalization growth stocks. The fund employs a passive management investment approach designed to track the performance of the MSCI US Prime Market Growth index, a broadly diversified index of growth stocks of large U.S. companies. It attempts to replicate the target index by investing all, or substantially all, of assets in the stocks that make up the index, holding each stock in approximately the same proportion as its weighting in the index.

Fund.ManagerBio: Schow is a chairman and co-founder of PRIMECAP Management Company. Previously, he spent twenty-seven years with Capital Group, Inc. From 1966 to 1982, Schow served as chairman of its Investment Committee. He was president, a founder, and lead portfolio counselor of AMCAP Fund. Schow was also a portfolio counselor of Investment Company of America and American Mutual Fund, two other mutual funds managed by Capital Research and Management Company. He has been a portfolio counselor since 1962.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital. The fund invests primarily in equity securities of mid- and large-capitalization stocks. The fund invests in stocks considered to have above-average earnings growth potential that is not reflected in their current market prices. The companies' market values range from $3 billion to $30 billion. The advisor selects companies on the basis of fundamental factors, including current earnings, consistency, and quality of earnings growth. The advisor then evaluates these factors in relation to the market price of each company's stock to determine which investments to make.
Fund.Name: Vanguard PRIMECAP

It attempts to replicate the target index by investing all, or substantially all, of assets in the stocks that make up the index, holding each stock in approximately the same proportion as its weighting in the index.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Small Cap Index

Fund.ManagerBio: No Bio.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term capital appreciation and income. The fund allocates assets in the following proportions: 60%-70% in common stocks through eight stock funds; 20% to 30% of assets in bonds through two bond funds; and 10% to 20% of assets in short-term investments through a short-term bond fund. It is nondiversified.
Fund.Name: Vanguard STAR

Fund.ManagerBio: Troyer serves as principal of Vanguard Group, Inc. He has worked in investment management since 1979 and has managed funds of Vanguard. Troyer holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term total return. The fund normally invests in small and mid capitalization domestic stocks. To select investments, the advisor uses a proprietary quantitative valuation model to assess the total return potential of different market segments, categorized by two levels: market capitalization and growth versus value. The fund emphasizes small and mid-size companies, though it may invest in larger companies. Factors considered in choosing individual securities include market liquidity, valuation measures, and financial strength relative to other stocks.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Strategic Equity

Fund.ManagerBio: Stetler is principal of Vanguard. He has been with Vanguard since 1982,
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term capital appreciation. The fund normally invests in small-capitalization domestic stocks based on the advisor's assessment of the relative return potential of the securities. The advisor selects securities that it believes offer a good balance between reasonable valuations and attractive growth prospects relative to their peers.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Strategic Small-Cap Equity

Fund.ManagerBio: Troyer serves as principal of Vanguard Group, Inc. He has worked in investment management since 1979 and has managed funds of Vanguard. Troyer holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.

The fund primarily invests in large-capitalization domestic stocks based on the management's assessment of the relative return potential of the securities. The management selects securities that it believes offer a good balance between reasonable valuations and attractive growth prospects relative to their peers, by using proprietary software programs that allow comparisons among thousands of securities at a time.

Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to provide a tax-efficient investment return consisting of federally tax-exempt income, long-term capital appreciation, and a modest amount of taxable current income. The fund normally invests 50-55% of assets in municipal securities and the balance in common stocks. At least 75% of the municipal bonds purchased by the fund will be rated in one of the top three credit-rating categories.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Tax-Managed Balanced

It also emphasizes low-yielding stocks.

Fund.ManagerBio: OReilly is a principal and portfolio manager with Vanguard, his employer since 1992. He has managed stock index portfolios since 1994.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of the overall stock market. The fund employs a passive management strategy designed to track the performance of the MSCI US Broad Market index, which consists of all the U.S. common stocks traded regularly on the NYSE, AMEX, or OTC markets. It typically invests substantially all of assets in the 1,300 largest stocks in its target index, thus covering nearly 95% of the Index's total market capitalization.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Total Stock Mkt Idx

Fund.ManagerBio: Levi is a senior vice president of AllianceBernstein. He has worked in investment management since 1973 and has been with Alliance for his entire investment management career.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital. The fund invests primarily in large-capitalization stocks of seasoned U.S. companies with above-average earnings growth and reasonable stocks prices. In selecting investments, the advisor emphasizes companies that it believes to have exceptional growth records, strong market positions, reasonable financial strength, and relatively low sensitivity to changing economic conditions.
Fund.Name: Vanguard U.S. Growth

Fund.ManagerBio: Levi is a senior vice president of AllianceBernstein. He has worked in investment management since 1973 and has been with Alliance for his entire investment management career.

Fund.ManagerBio: Wilderman is the director of U.S. equity management since 2005 and is responsible for all US quantitative equities portfolio management at Grantham, Mayo, Van Otterloo & Co. LLC (GMO). Prior to this, he was a member of GMOs Emerging Markets Equity Group for nine years, focusing on research and portfolio management. Wilderman joined GMO in 1996. Wilderman holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: Vanguard U.S. Value Fund seeks long-term growth of capital and income. The fund invests primarily in U.S. common stocks, with a focus on value stocks. It invests in stocks of small, medium and large companies by using a computerized model to identify stocks that are trading at lower prices below the fundamental value of the underlying companies. The fund may invest up to 15% of its assets in restricted securities with limited marketability or other illiquid securities. It may also invest, to a limited extent, in stock futures and options contracts.
Fund.Name: Vanguard U.S. Value

Fund.ManagerBio: No biography.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of utilities stocks. The Fund employs a passive management investment approach designed to track the performance of the MSCI U.S. Investable Market Utilities Index. This index consists of all capitalization companies within the utilities sector. This sector comprises of those companies considered electric, gas, or water utilities, or companies that operate as independent producers and/or distributors of power. The sector includes both nuclear and nonnuclear facilities.
Fund.Name: Vanguard Utilities Index Adm

Fund.ManagerBio: McEvoy is senior vice president and portfolio manager with Wellington Management Company, his employer since 1978. Previously, he spent two years with Boston Consulting Group and four years with First National Bank of Boston.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks to provide long-term growth of income and a high and sustainable level of current income, along with moderate long-term capital appreciation. The fund invests approximately 60% to 65% of its assets in investment-grade corporate, U.S. Treasury, and government agency bonds, as well as mortgage-backed securities. The remaining 35% to 40% of fund assets are invested in common stocks of companies that have a history of above-average dividends or expectations of increasing dividends.

He is principal and founding partner of Barrow, Hanley, Mewhinney & Strauss. Barrow founded the firm in 1980. Previously, he spent eight years with Republic National Bank. Barrow has been in investment management since 1965.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks long-term growth of capital; current income is a secondary consideration. The fund invests primarily in undervalued stocks of medium and large companies, characterized by above-average dividend yields and below-average price/earnings ratios relative to the stock market. It may invest up to 20% of assets in foreign securities. The fund may also invest a portion of assets in money market instruments, fixed-income securities, convertible securities, and other equity securities, such as preferred stocks.

Fund.ManagerBio: Lewis is a managing director at Van Kampen Asset Management. He joined the firm in 1986. Previously, he spent three years as an analyst with USAA Investment Management and four years as an analyst with Comerica Bank. Lewis is a member of the Houston Society of Financial Analysts. Lewis holds a Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks capital growth. The fund focuses primarily on equity securities of small- and medium-sized companies. It invests primarily in common stocks and other equity securities of companies that believed have an above-average potential for capital growth. The fund seeks those companies that it believes are currently mispriced based on growth expectations and the sustainability of that growth in the market. It may invest up to 25% of its total assets in securities of foreign issuers.
Fund.Name: Van Kampen Aggressive Growth A

Fund.Name: Van Kampen Limited Duration C

Fund.ManagerBio: Cohen is a portfolio manager and managing director with Van Kampen Asset Management, his employer since 1993. Prior to that, he was a senior fund accountant at Alliance Capital. Previously, he was a fund accountant at Natwest and Wall Street Trust.
Fund.FundSummary: The investment seeks capital growth. The fund primarily invests in common stocks and other equity securities issued by growth companies. Growth companies include those with established records of growth in sales or earnings and companies with new products, services, or processes that the advisor judges to offer above-average potential for capital growth. The fund may invest up to 25% of assets in foreign securities.
Fund.Name: Van Kampen Mid Cap Growth A
